meanings.definition: A membranous sac in which the eggs of certain insects are deposited.
meanings.sent1: The ovisacs of the butterfly protect its eggs.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ovisacs of the ant to learn more about its reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The ovisacs of the beetle were so well hidden that even the other insects couldn't find them.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like the ovisacs of a spider, carefully holding her ideas until they were ready to hatch.
meanings.sent5: The delicate ovisacs of the moth shimmered in the sunlight, a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A sac in which the eggs of certain animals, such as insects or mollusks, are deposited and develop.
meanings.sent1: The ovisacs of the snail were carefully tended to by the mother.
meanings.sent2: The farmer observed the ovisacs of the chicken to ensure they were healthy.
meanings.sent3: The ovisacs of the fish were like tiny treasure chests waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like the ovisacs of a bee, full of buzzing emotions waiting to burst forth.
meanings.sent5: The ovisacs of the frog were a fascinating subject for the curious child to explore.
